comments.body: What happens the second time this condition is set to true here? Will it trigger another update of the URD and therefore cause the worker queue to pick it up again for another try? Or will the deletion stop here because the condition didn't change anymore?

> What happens the second time this condition is set to true here? Will it trigger another update of the URD and therefore cause the worker queue to pick it up again for another try? Or will the deletion stop here because the condition didn't change anymore?

Interesting unintended consequences.  It requeues for retry at the end of the queue.  Guess I should build out the full state machine to avoid resetting myself each time.
Updated to prevent hotlooping by skipping the enqueue on updates which only changed the terminating condition.
The queue already deduplicates, right? So worst case we retry as often as the queue rate limiter allows, which was my suggestion earlier anyway. Is there a true hotloop scenario I'm missing?
